comment: Dr Henley is a great professor. Her enthusiasm for the subject is contagious. Classes are discussion based and really thought provoking. Exams are thorough but fair. Take good notes and know the material on the review sheets for the A. I wish she taught more classes!
very nice and sober human being and great professor. you will love her class.

Very knowledgeable about the subject and teaches her class very well.  Material is well presented.  Fortunately, we didn't have any group projects, although she normally does give them out.  Overall, an excellent professor.
Attendance is not mandatory but her lectures are spot on with the exams. Interesting subjects and overall pretty easy.

This is a very qualitative, subjective course.  The material is common sense, but you still learn a lot.  Dr. Henley is extremely pleasant.  The class sessions are enjoyable.  The tests have a lot of material, but aren't overly difficulty.

Professor Amy is very knowledgeable. There is lot of material to grasp, but all the questions come from her presentations. She is very reasonable at grading. Text book is used for only writing cases. Highly recommend her.
She is fair in grading and amount of work load. Helps you know what may come in exam. I would recommend her

Class was taken during the 5 day Maymester so it was intense for the amount of subject matter presented. 1 daily essay quiz that came directly from her slides. The book is probably not necessary, b/c her slides are taken directly from it. Amy is extremely knowlegeable and brings a lot of excitment to the course. Recommended for the minimester.
I LOVE HER. SHE IS COOL, CALM AND VERY KNOWLEDGABLE ABOUT THE MATERIAL. I WILL HONOR HER DURING MY GRADUATION. SHE IS AWESOME!!!!

She was frequently off topic and talked a lot about herself. Grades were not posted or returned when said. Having said that, the material is easy to understand and the tests come with a study guide. Participation is "graded" and exams are very easy. Don't buy the book, just get the cases online or from someone in the class.

Professor knew the subject matter well and kept the discussions interesting.  There are 3 cases required, as well as a major project.   This is in addition to two difficult exams.  She grades fairly and I would recommend this course and the instructor.

Took as a MAcc elective in Fall 2010. Henley is a great teacher. She creates a fun and open learning environment. She gives study guides for the tests and pulls her test questions from the study guide. There are a lot of topics on the study guide but if you study everything about all the topics on the study guide, you'll get an A. I recommend!!

Professor did an excellent job keeping the course interesting! (not easy for a late night course)  She knew the material well, although a broader management background in the non-academic world would improve her knowledge base/give varying examples of mgmt principles.  Exams were thorough, but fairly graded.  I would recommend this intructor!

I thought she really made the course concepts understandable - this wasn't one of those classes where you're not sure what the point was. I think I really learned a lot about interacting in the workplace. But, she does keep you busy - there's a big group project and some individual essays. Overall, I'd say you should take her class.
Brilliant, informative, funny, fair but tough grader. Take her class!

One of the best teachers that I have had in the MBA program at KSU.  Makes difficult material understandable and is a very fair grader. Her teaching style of engaging the class helps with comprehension and retention.  Wish she taught more classes!

Not bad, but not great.  At times seemed scatter-brained and off-topic.  Using politics as an example brought out the nimrods in the class and led to chaos.  What to expect = workload is fairly light, but tests are 2.5 hr essay tests.  If you study and bring an ice pack for your wrist, its a breeze.
Rather than just lecturing, Dr. Henley is able to engage the class in discussion.  She is obviously interested in everyone understanding the topics covered.
material hard to understand sometimes, but she tries to make it as interesting as possible. small team project is easy. worth taking the info is very relative to about to graduate students.

Compensation was a tough class, as far as the material. There were 3-4 test and a small team project. Amy was fun and made the class interesting. She is very organized and the test are fair. You should do fine on the test if you study and show up to class to understand the concepts. I would recommend taking her.
Good teacher. Subject material was interesting. Fair grader. Enjoyed class immensely.
Take notes.  Check out the chapters before the tests.  Easy material, easy class.
